definition: to turn right
right (-hand)/the Right (politics)/west (old)
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: Immediate turn right 90 degrees, fast moving target at 12 o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 立即右轉90度快速移動目標在正前方。

sentences.english: Turn right onto Ford Road and take the first street on your left.
sentences.chinese: 右轉到福特路，然後第一條街左轉。

sentences.english: Go down the road. Then turn right at the first crossing.
sentences.chinese: 這條路直走，然後在第一個十字路口右轉。

sentences.english: When you run into a wall, turn right.
Then turn right onto Van Ness Avenue.
Turn right at the first turning.
B：Yes, then, at the traffic light, turn right onto Ocean Road.
sentences.chinese: 是的，然後在紅綠燈向右轉向海洋大道。

sentences.english: Drop your knees down to the right without allowing your body to follow.
sentences.chinese: 將雙膝向右側放下，同時身體上部不能隨之右轉。

sentences.english: You just keep walking to the end, then turn right, you will see it.
sentences.chinese: 你向前走到底，再右轉，就會看見他的辦公室。

sentences.english: I swerved right and hit the curb.
sentences.chinese: 我猛向右轉撞上了路牙子。

sentences.english: Go straight ahead, then turn right.
sentences.chinese: 沿着這條路直走，然後右轉。

sentences.english: Go ahead along the road and turn right at the first crossing.
sentences.chinese: 沿着知春路一直走，在第一個十字路口右轉。

sentences.english: Turn left at the library. Go straight down Xinhua Street.
sentences.chinese: 在圖書館向右轉，沿着新華大街一直走。

sentences.english: Right turn, the first line left turn and jog, the second and third lines follow.
sentences.chinese: 向右轉，第一排左轉彎跑步走，後兩排跟上。

sentences.english: Officials say the bus veered to the right and crashed into a sound barrier wall along the highway.
sentences.chinese: 有官員說是巴士在右轉時撞上樂沿着高速路的聲障牆。

sentences.english: When you see a church on your left hand side, turn right at the cross street.
sentences.chinese: 當你在左手邊看到一間教堂時，在十字路口右轉。

definition: to turn left
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
main entrance/main gate/portal
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
Tianqiao district of Jinan city 濟南市|济南市[Ji3 nan2 shi4], Shandong/Tianqiao district in Beijing, formerly a center of folk culture
overhead walkway/pedestrian bridge
(sitting) opposite/across (the street)/directly in front/to be face to face
to cross the street
left/the left side/to the left of
the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus
right side/right, to the right
parking lot/car park
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
to turn/to go around a corner
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
traffic light/traffic signal
public square/plaza
